meanings.definition: To cover or smear with a sticky substance.
meanings.sent1: She was beduncing the paper with glue.
meanings.sent2: The child enjoyed beduncing the cake with frosting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept beduncing its paws with mud.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush danced across the canvas, beduncing it with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The chef was beduncing the dish with a drizzle of sauce, adding a final touch of flavor.

meanings.definition: To make something dirty or messy.
meanings.sent1: The playful kittens were beduncing the room with their muddy paws.
meanings.sent2: Raindrops beduncing the window made it hard to see outside.
meanings.sent3: The children were beduncing each other with paint during the art class.
meanings.sent4: The wind was beduncing the freshly swept path with fallen leaves.
meanings.sent5: The clumsy waiter ended up beduncing the floor with spilled drinks.

meanings.definition: To apply a liquid or paste to something.
meanings.sent1: She was beduncing sunscreen on her skin before going to the beach.
meanings.sent2: The baker was beduncing flour on the dough to prevent sticking.
meanings.sent3: The gardener was beduncing fertilizer on the plants for better growth.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic was beduncing oil on the rusty hinges to loosen them.
meanings.sent5: The artist was beduncing paint on the canvas, creating a masterpiece.
